eco_notes_detailed: Explicitly called 'eco-friendly'. Implements natural lighting, energy-efficient systems, and improved waste management. Incorporates green spaces into office environments and promotes sustainability within their offices. Initiatives to reduce carbon footprint.
name: Shinei Office Space
description_long: Shinei Office Space, located in Sermmit Tower, Asoke, provides a range of flexible workspace solutions including private offices, shared coworking areas, and virtual office services. It is positioned as an eco-friendly option, committed to environmental sustainability and reducing its carbon footprint through green initiatives.

eco_notes_detailed: Strong emphasis on biophilic design with natural elements and live plants throughout the space. The office features energy-efficient lighting systems, waste sorting stations, and uses sustainably sourced materials in its construction and furnishings. Large windows maximize natural light, reducing energy consumption. The space actively promotes eco-conscious practices among its community members through regular workshops and sustainability challenges.
name: JustCo One City Centre
description_long: JustCo One City Centre, located on floors 37-40 of One City Centre, Ploenchit, integrates nature into its workspace through biophilic design elements, including live plants, natural wood furnishings, and expansive windows that let in ample sunlight. The design emphasizes sustainability and a connection with nature.

eco_notes_detailed: Pier Lab explicitly promotes sustainable practices with a strong focus on eco-friendly transportation solutions. The space features Thailand's first electrical Tuk-Tuk charging station, encouraging green commuting options. The interior incorporates upcycled and recycled materials in its furniture and decor. They implement comprehensive waste sorting and recycling programs and use water-saving fixtures throughout the facility. The riverfront location not only provides inspiring views but also connects members with Bangkok's historical waterways, promoting awareness of water conservation issues.
name: Pier Lab
description_long: Pier Lab is a coworking space located on the second floor of Tha Maharaj, Bangkok, that offers a unique riverbank view. The space emphasizes sustainable practices and has initiatives such as an electrical Tuk Tuk charging station to support green transportation.

eco_notes_detailed: Plantiful demonstrates a comprehensive approach to sustainability. Their menu is 100% plant-based, significantly reducing their carbon footprint. They source ingredients from local organic farms within a 100km radius of Bangkok whenever possible. All takeaway containers and utensils are made from biodegradable materials, and they offer discounts to customers who bring their own containers. The cafe's interior features reclaimed wood furniture, living plant walls that improve air quality, and energy-efficient lighting and appliances. Their commitment extends to water conservation with low-flow fixtures and a rainwater collection system that waters their decorative plants and herb garden.
name: Plantiful
description_long: Plantiful is a trendy cafe with locations in The Commons Thonglor and Siam Center, dedicated to nutritious plant-based cuisine. The interior features sustainable materials, living plant walls, and natural lighting. Their signature dishes include superfood smoothie bowls, avocado toast on sourdough, and hearty grain-based salads, all prepared with locally-sourced, organic ingredients whenever possible.

description_short: Stylish plant-based cafe serving nutritious, eco-conscious food in a digital nomad-friendly environment.

eco_notes_detailed: Bangkok Tree House exemplifies comprehensive sustainability. The entire property operates on solar power with backup systems only for emergencies. Their innovative water management includes rainwater harvesting, natural filtration systems, and constructed wetlands for wastewater treatment. All structures are built using bamboo, reclaimed wood, and other sustainable materials with minimal concrete. Food waste is composted on-site for their organic garden, which supplies the restaurant with fresh produce. Single-use plastics are banned throughout the property, with alternatives like bamboo straws and refillable toiletry dispensers. The resort actively educates guests about local ecology through guided tours of the mangrove ecosystem and workshops on sustainable living practices. They employ local community members and support conservation efforts in the Bang Krachao 'green lung' area.
name: Bangkok Tree House
description_long: Bangkok Tree House is an innovative eco-resort nestled in the lush 'green lung' of Bangkok, a protected mangrove forest just outside the city center. The resort features elevated treehouse-style rooms designed with sustainable materials and minimal environmental impact. Accessible only by boat or bicycle, this unique property offers a stark contrast to urban Bangkok with its pristine natural surroundings, organic garden-to-table dining, and comprehensive sustainability initiatives including solar power, natural water filtration, and zero-waste policies.
address_string: 60 Moo 1, Soi Bua Phueng Pattana, Bang Namphueng, Phra Pradaeng, Samut Prakan 10130
description_short: Award-winning eco-resort with unique treehouse-style accommodations in Bangkok's green lung area.

eco_notes_detailed: Hub53 demonstrates holistic sustainability through multiple initiatives. The buildings incorporate natural cooling systems and passive ventilation to reduce energy consumption. Reclaimed wood, bamboo, and recycled materials feature prominently in furniture and construction. The property maintains organic vegetable gardens that supply their cafe and hosts composting workshops. Their community outreach includes educational programs on sustainable living, monthly environmental awareness events, and partnerships with local eco-organizations. They've eliminated single-use plastics throughout the facility and implemented comprehensive recycling systems. The tropical gardens feature native plants that support local biodiversity and create natural shade to reduce cooling needs.
name: Hub53 Coworking and Coliving
description_long: Hub53 is a vibrant coworking and coliving community center near Chiang Mai University that combines modern work amenities with eco-friendly design. The property features lush tropical gardens, upcycled furniture, energy-efficient architecture, and natural building materials. Beyond just a workspace, Hub53 functions as a sustainable community hub hosting workshops on zero-waste living, urban gardening, and regular community clean-up initiatives around Chiang Mai.

eco_notes_detailed: Features include abundant natural light and eco-friendly design elements that create a modern, sustainable workspace.
name: Greenovation Phuket
description_long: Greenovation Phuket is a four-floor coworking space designed to blend work and environmental consciousness. Located in Pa Klok, it offers sunny workspaces, natural lighting, and a relaxed ambiance that fosters creativity and sustainability.
address_string: Pa Klok, Thalang District, Phuket
description_short: Innovative coworking space with a green concept in Phuket.

eco_notes_detailed: Utilizes renewable energy and sustainable building materials, with organic dining options and eco-friendly amenities.
name: Coco Lanta Eco Resort
description_long: Coco Lanta Eco Resort offers bungalow-style accommodations right on the beachfront in Koh Lanta. It emphasizes sustainable practices such as water conservation and green energy initiatives, providing guests with an eco-friendly and relaxing stay.
address_string: Klong Khong, Koh Lanta
description_short: Beachfront eco-resort combining sustainable practices with relaxation.

eco_notes_detailed: Mala Dhara exemplifies sustainable building practices with its adobe structures made from local earth, rice husks, and natural materials. The entire property runs primarily on solar power and practices comprehensive water conservation with rainwater harvesting and natural filtration systems. Their permaculture farm demonstrates regenerative agriculture techniques, providing organic vegetables and fruits for the on-site vegan restaurant. They offer educational workshops on sustainable building, permaculture, and low-impact living. All cleaning products are biodegradable, and they maintain a strict zero plastic policy throughout the resort. The property actively engages with the local community through employment opportunities and educational programs for local students.
name: Mala Dhara Eco Resort & Yoga Retreat
description_long: Mala Dhara is a serene eco-resort and yoga retreat located 40 minutes from Chiang Mai city. Built entirely using sustainable earthen building techniques, the resort features unique adobe bungalows, a salt-water pool, and operates a permaculture farm producing organic fruits and vegetables. The retreat offers a perfect balance of sustainability, comfort, and Thai rural charm for digital nomads seeking a peaceful workspace surrounded by nature.
address_string: 193 Moo 7, Don Pao, Mae Wang, Chiang Mai 50360
description_short: Sustainable yoga retreat and eco-resort built with natural materials featuring an organic permaculture farm.

eco_notes_detailed: Keemala demonstrates exceptional commitment to sustainability through several key initiatives. Their 'Enchanted Garden' produces organic herbs, vegetables, and fruits that supply their farm-to-table restaurants. Water conservation is achieved through advanced rainwater harvesting systems, greywater recycling for garden irrigation, and low-flow fixtures throughout the property. The architectural design maximizes natural ventilation and lighting while blending seamlessly with the natural landscape to minimize environmental disruption. All villas use locally-sourced materials and traditional building techniques where possible, combined with modern energy-efficient systems. The resort maintains a zero single-use plastic policy and implements comprehensive waste separation and recycling. They also engage with the local community through employment opportunities, cultural preservation efforts, and educational programs about environmental conservation.
name: Keemala Eco-Resort
description_long: Keemala is a luxury eco-resort nestled on a hillside overlooking Kamala Village and the Andaman Sea. The resort features unique treehouse villas and cottages designed to blend harmoniously with the surrounding forest. Beyond luxury, Keemala maintains strong sustainability practices including an extensive organic garden, energy conservation initiatives, and wildlife preservation programs. The resort's design incorporates rainwater harvesting, natural ventilation, and locally-sourced construction materials.
address_string: 10/88 Moo 6, Nakasud Road, Kamala, Kathu, Phuket 83150
description_short: Luxury eco-resort with unique treehouse villas built with sustainable principles and organic gardens.

eco_notes_detailed: Oasis Yoga Bungalows exemplifies small-scale sustainable tourism on Koh Lanta. Their bungalows are constructed primarily from local bamboo, reclaimed wood, and other renewable materials with minimal concrete. The property uses a combination of solar power and energy-efficient systems to reduce electricity consumption. Water conservation is achieved through rainwater harvesting, low-flow fixtures, and greywater recycling for their organic garden. They maintain a strict zero single-use plastic policy, providing filtered water stations and biodegradable toiletries. Food waste is composted for their garden which supplies herbs and vegetables for their cafe. The owners actively participate in beach clean-ups and local conservation initiatives, and they employ staff from the local community. Their approach demonstrates how a small property can implement comprehensive sustainability practices while providing a comfortable, authentic experience.
name: Oasis Yoga Bungalows
description_long: Oasis Yoga Bungalows is an intimate eco-retreat located steps from Long Beach on Koh Lanta. This family-run property features six unique bamboo bungalows designed with natural ventilation and built using sustainable materials. The retreat operates with a strong environmental ethos including zero-waste practices, an organic garden, and comprehensive water conservation systems. Beyond accommodation, they offer daily yoga classes, plant-based meals, and a supportive community for digital nomads seeking a mindful workspace in paradise.
address_string: 272 Moo 3, Sala Dan, Koh Lanta, Krabi 81150
description_short: Eco-friendly yoga retreat with sustainable bamboo bungalows featuring organic garden and zero-waste initiatives.

eco_notes_detailed: Pun Pun represents a comprehensive approach to sustainability centered around food sovereignty and ecological practices. The cafe sources nearly all its ingredients from their own organic farm or local farmers practicing sustainable agriculture. Their seed-saving initiative preserves traditional Thai crop varieties that might otherwise disappear due to industrial agriculture. The restaurant itself is constructed using natural building techniques including adobe, bamboo, and reclaimed materials. They practice comprehensive waste management with composting of all food scraps and use of biodegradable packaging. Water conservation includes rainwater collection and greywater systems for garden irrigation. The organization regularly conducts workshops on sustainable living practices including natural building, permaculture, seed saving, and plant-based cooking. Their holistic approach demonstrates how food systems can be regenerative rather than extractive, while creating meaningful community connections.
name: Pun Pun Organic Farm & Restaurant
description_long: Pun Pun Organic Farm & Restaurant is more than just a cafe—it's a center for sustainable living and seed preservation located at Wat Suan Dok Temple. This peaceful garden cafe serves delicious vegetarian Thai cuisine made with organic ingredients grown at their farm. Beyond serving food, Pun Pun is part of a larger movement promoting seed saving, sustainable agriculture, natural building, and community self-reliance. The restaurant provides a tranquil workspace among garden beds and earthen structures, making it ideal for digital nomads seeking inspiration in a sustainability-focused environment.

description_long: TLoft Co-Working Space, located in Suriyawong, Bang Rak, promotes a seamless work-life balance. It features an inspirational setting with a seamless blend of greenery and mid-century modern design, and lush green surrounds.

eco_notes_detailed: Described as having a 'modern, green setting'. Features a 'sizable play yard out front', suggesting outdoor green space.
name: Hubba (Sathorn Hub / Hubba Thailand)
description_long: Hubba, with its Sathorn Hub, offers a flexible coworking environment for growing businesses. It provides entrepreneurial programs, mentorships, and events. The space is characterized by a modern, green setting and features a sizable outdoor play yard.
address_string: Naradhiwas Rajanagarindra Rd, Bangkok
description_short: Flexible coworking space in Sathorn with a modern, green setting and outdoor play yard.

eco_notes_detailed: Features a greenhouse setting. Surrounded by gardens, providing a green and natural ambience. Pet-friendly.
name: Dusit Gourmet (at Baan Dusit Thani)
description_long: Dusit Gourmet, located within the Baan Dusit Thani complex, is a coffeeshop offering pastries and light bites. It is distinguished by its greenhouse setting and is surrounded by lush gardens, providing a green and natural ambience. It is also pet-friendly.
address_string: Baan Dusit Thani, Sala Daeng, Bangkok
description_short: Coffeeshop in Baan Dusit Thani with a greenhouse setting, surrounded by gardens.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Abundant greenery for inspiration.' 'Surrounded by plenty of plants.' Uses charming vintage furniture, potentially upcycled/repurposed.
name: Piccolo Vicolo Café
description_long: Piccolo Vicolo Café is situated in GalileOasis, an arts and community hub in Bangkok. It's recognized for its quality coffee and features abundant greenery and charming vintage furniture, creating an inspirational atmosphere.
address_string: GalileOasis, Bangkok
description_short: Cafe in GalileOasis arts hub, known for quality coffee, abundant greenery, and vintage furniture.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Green, leafy ambience.' Focus on fresh ingredients, potentially locally sourced for their bakery and cafe items.
name: Bartels
description_long: Bartels is a cafe with multiple locations in Bangkok, popular for its sourdough bread, sandwiches, fresh juices, and coffee. It offers a green and leafy ambience, focusing on fresh ingredients.
address_string: Multiple locations (e.g., Sukhumvit)
description_short: Cafe known for sourdough, sandwiches, fresh juice, and coffee, with a green, leafy ambience.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Plant-filled destination.' Excellent city views and natural light due to its location and design. The concept encourages shared space usage. (Note: This is a large venue containing multiple individual eateries; specific eco-practices of sub-vendors may vary).
name: Open House Central Embassy
description_long: Open House, located on the 6th floor of Central Embassy, is a vast, open-concept 'co-thinking space'. It integrates a bookstore with various cafes and restaurants, creating a plant-filled destination with excellent city views and natural light. The shared nature of the space itself promotes efficient use of resources.
address_string: 6th floor, Central Embassy, Bangkok
description_short: Large, plant-filled co-thinking space in Central Embassy with multiple cafes and restaurants.

eco_notes_detailed: Features a 'beautiful garden'. The parent hotel (Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok) has Gold Level Green Hotel Award and Silver LEED Award, supporting local single-origin coffee/chocolate, avoiding single-use plastics, and having significant green space.
name: CRAFT (at Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok)
description_long: CRAFT is a pet-friendly coffeeshop located on the ground floor of the Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok hotel in Langsuan. It is noted for its beautiful garden, offering a lively ambience with potential for outdoor seating in a green setting. The hotel itself has sustainability certifications.
address_string: Ground floor, Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok, Langsuan, Bangkok
description_short: Pet-friendly coffeeshop at Kimpton Maa-Lai hotel with a beautiful garden setting.

eco_notes_detailed: Certified Gold Level – Green Hotel Award from Thailand’s DEQP. Silver LEED Award. Guest rooms and meeting spaces utilize solar power via grand windows. Triple-layered glass panels for noise reduction and reduced AC use. Significant green space (41% of its 8,503 sqm area is green). Supports local single-origin coffee and chocolate. Avoids single-use plastics, uses biodegradable straws, tissues, and eco-friendly amenities. Offers bikes and electric scooters for guests. Partners with Steps Organization to welcome trainees/employees with neurodivergent disabilities.
name: Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok
description_long: The Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok is the flagship Kimpton hotel in Asia, located in the Langsuan area. It holds significant sustainability certifications (Gold Level Green Hotel Award, Silver LEED Award) and implements various eco-friendly practices, including solar power utilization, green spaces, local sourcing, and plastic reduction.
address_string: Langsuan, Bangkok
description_short: Luxury hotel in Langsuan with strong sustainability certifications and practices.

eco_notes_detailed: Made from 17 old shipping containers (upcycled materials). Relies solely on LED lighting. Nestled in a green space, opens into it. Rx Café on-site brews locally grown beans. Associated with an institute focused on sustainable development.
name: The Hub Chiang Mai (by ISDSI)
description_long: The Hub Chiang Mai, operated by the International Sustainable Development Studies Institute (ISDSI), is a unique coworking space constructed from 17 old shipping containers. It is dedicated to sustainability, experiential learning, and community, featuring LED lighting, green spaces, and an on-site café brewing locally grown beans.
address_string: Chiang Mai (exact address to be confirmed, near ISDSI)
description_short: Coworking space by ISDSI, made from shipping containers, focused on sustainability and community.

eco_notes_detailed: Alt_PingRiver converted from an old Thai house (potential preservation/upcycling). Emphasis on natural light. Partnerships with eco-conscious brands: 'Leaf' (eco-friendly travel essentials), 'Superbee' (eco-friendly, plastic-free products by empowered women), 'INBAAN' (organic, all-natural products). Bella Goose Coffee (partner cafe) serves organic Chiang Mai americano.
name: Alt_ChiangMai Coworking & Coliving / Alt_PingRiver
description_long: Alt_ChiangMai offers two locations (Old Centre and Ping River) for coliving and coworking. They emphasize design, community, and a supportive environment. The Alt_PingRiver location is a converted old Thai house. They partner with several eco-conscious brands for amenities and products.
address_string: Two locations: Old Centre and Ping River, Chiang Mai
description_short: Coliving and coworking spaces in Chiang Mai with a focus on design, community, and partnerships with eco-conscious brands.

eco_notes_detailed: Described as 'more "close to nature" than other coworking spots.' Features a 'massive outdoor patio and garden area.' 'Plenty of trees surrounding the space.' Large green lawn for working, with hammocks and benches. Remodeled from a soda factory (adaptive reuse).
name: Punspace (Wiang Kaew branch)
description_long: Punspace (Wiang Kaew branch) is located in Chiang Mai’s Old Town and was remodeled from an old soda factory. It is described as being more 'close to nature' than other coworking spots, featuring a massive outdoor patio, garden area, and plenty of surrounding trees. It offers a large green lawn with hammocks and benches for working.
address_string: Wiang Kaew, Chiang Mai Old Town
description_short: Coworking space in Chiang Mai's Old Town, remodeled from a soda factory, with a large outdoor patio and garden.

eco_notes_detailed: Name itself implies a green focus. Described as having an 'indoor-outdoor vibe, complete with trees and plants, making it feel super cozy.' Website shows images with significant greenery.
name: Greenhouse Community Space
description_long: Greenhouse Community Space, located in the Nimman area of Chiang Mai, is focused on Asia's media ecosystem. It offers an indoor-outdoor vibe, complete with trees and plants, creating a cozy atmosphere. The name itself suggests a green focus.
address_string: Nimman area, Chiang Mai
description_short: Coworking space in Nimman with an indoor-outdoor vibe, trees, and plants.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Quiet, cozy (yet somehow spacious) environment with garden views inside and out.' 'Feels like a rural retreat with its lush vegetation, tree swing, and pond surrounding the building.'
name: Planter’s Space
description_long: Planter’s Space, located a 10-minute walk from Maya Mall in Chiang Mai, offers a rustic coworking environment. It's described as feeling like a rural retreat with its lush vegetation, tree swing, and a pond surrounding the building, providing garden views both inside and out.
address_string: Near Maya Mall, Chiang Mai (10-min walk)
description_short: Coworking space near Maya Mall with a rustic, garden-retreat feel, lush vegetation, and a pond.

address_string: Nimman, Chiang Mai
description_short: Coworking space in Nimman with an indoor-outdoor vibe, plants, and natural light from skylights.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Committed to sustainability, with eco-friendly practices and green spaces throughout the property.' 'Uses energy-efficient systems and promotes waste reduction.' Listed in 'The 10 coolest coworking spaces in Thailand for Digital Nomads!' on TheDigitalNomad.Asia.
name: HOMA Phuket Town / HOMA Cherngtalay
description_long: HOMA offers modern co-living and coworking spaces at two locations in Phuket: Phuket Town and Cherngtalay. They are committed to sustainability, incorporating eco-friendly practices, green spaces, energy-efficient systems, and waste reduction measures.
address_string: Two locations: Phuket Town and Cherngtalay, Phuket
description_short: Modern co-living and coworking spaces in Phuket, committed to sustainability with eco-friendly practices.

eco_notes_detailed: Proximity to water and restaurants within walking distance might encourage less vehicle use. (Specific eco-initiatives not explicitly detailed in provided snippets, would require deeper check).

description_long: Let's Work is a coworking space located in Rawai, Phuket, offering views of the water. Its proximity to the water and walkable restaurants might encourage less vehicle use.
address_string: Rawai, Phuket
description_short: Coworking space in Rawai, Phuket, with views of the water.

eco_notes_detailed: Specific eco-initiatives not explicitly detailed, but a focus on well-being and potentially natural surroundings at Rawai Beach could be relevant.
name: Grind Time Coworking Space
description_long: Grind Time Coworking Space operates in two locations in Phuket: Chalong Bay and Rawai Beach. The Rawai Beach location is noted for its cheerful decor, gym, and pool table, while the Chalong Bay site offers a silent floor.
address_string: Two locations: Chalong Bay & Rawai Beach, Phuket
description_short: Coworking space with locations in Chalong Bay and Rawai Beach, Phuket.

eco_notes_detailed: Specific eco-initiatives not explicitly detailed in provided snippets.
name: The Project
description_long: The Project is a coworking space located in Rawai, Phuket. It is known for its comfortable seating and the availability of phone booths.
address_string: Rawai, Phuket
description_short: Coworking space in Rawai, Phuket, known for comfy seating and phone booths.

eco_notes_detailed: Location suggests a connection with nature. Offers a full pantry/kitchen, which could help reduce waste from single-use takeaway containers if members cook/prepare food.
name: Coco Space
description_long: Coco Space is located on a hillside in South Phuket, near Chalong Temple, offering views of Big Buddha. Its location suggests a connection with nature. It provides a full pantry/kitchen, which could help reduce waste from single-use takeaway containers if members prepare their own food.
address_string: South Phuket, near Chalong Temple (hillside location)
description_short: Coworking space on a hillside in South Phuket with views and a full pantry/kitchen.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Farm' in the name suggests a focus on fresh, possibly locally sourced or on-site grown ingredients. Often associated with healthy and potentially organic/sustainable food options.
name: O-OH Farm Suanluang / O-OH Farm Ta-Eiad
description_long: O-OH Farm operates cafes in Suanluang and Ta-Eiad, Phuket. The 'farm' concept suggests a focus on fresh ingredients, potentially locally sourced or grown on-site, aligning with healthy and sustainable food options.
address_string: Two locations: Suanluang and Ta-Eiad, Phuket
description_short: Cafes in Phuket with a 'farm' concept, likely emphasizing fresh and potentially organic/sustainable food.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Surrounded by lush tropical gardens.' Emphasis on a 'peace & tranquility with the smell of fresh garden air.' Offers authentic Thai dishes, potentially using local ingredients.
name: Maybelle's Coffee Garden
description_long: Maybelle's Coffee Garden is a cafe and restaurant located in Kata, Phuket. It is set within tranquil tropical gardens, offering a peaceful atmosphere with the smell of fresh garden air. They serve authentic Thai dishes.
address_string: Kata, Phuket
description_short: Cafe and restaurant in Kata, Phuket, set in tranquil tropical gardens.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Situated in a lush garden.' Offers a quiet, natural setting away from hustle and bustle.
name: Sitsip Coffee
description_long: Sitsip Coffee is described as a hidden gem cafe located near Surin and Bang Tao beach in Phuket. It is situated in a lush garden, providing a quiet and natural setting away from the hustle and bustle.
address_string: Near Surin and Bang Tao beach, Phuket
description_short: Hidden gem cafe in Phuket, situated in a lush garden, offering a quiet and natural setting.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Surrounded by a beautiful garden, which made for a very tranquil setting.' Option for outdoor seating.

description_long: Hohiho Restaurant & Cafe is a fancy establishment located on a quiet street near Big Buddha in Phuket. It is surrounded by a beautiful garden, offering a tranquil setting and outdoor seating options.

description_short: Fancy cafe and restaurant near Big Buddha, Phuket, surrounded by a beautiful garden.

eco_notes_detailed: Set 'amid a tropical garden.' Serves 'tasty and healthy dishes,' potentially implying fresh, local sourcing.
name: Project Artisan Phuket (Garden Eatery)
description_long: Project Artisan Phuket, located near Layan Beach, is a hip hang-out spot featuring a Garden Eatery. It is set amidst a tropical garden and serves tasty and healthy dishes, potentially implying fresh, local sourcing.

description_short: Hip hang-out spot near Layan Beach with a Garden Eatery set in a tropical garden.

eco_notes_detailed: Vegan and raw food focus inherently promotes more sustainable dietary choices. Likely uses fresh, whole ingredients.
name: Raw Cafe & Vegan Bistro
description_long: Raw Cafe & Vegan Bistro, located in Rawai, Phuket, specializes in raw and vegan cuisine. This focus inherently promotes more sustainable dietary choices and likely involves the use of fresh, whole ingredients.
address_string: Rawai, Phuket
description_short: Cafe in Rawai, Phuket, focusing on raw and vegan food, promoting sustainable dietary choices.

eco_notes_detailed: Voluntarily treats local community wastewater. 272 million liter rainwater reservoir. Zero waste program: transforms food waste into fertilizer using biotechnology. Daily beach cleaning and regular 'Big Beach Clean' events. Installed solar panels generating 1,000,000 watts daily (with sister resort Katathani). Reviews mention 'jungle view' rooms.
name: The Shore At Katathani
description_long: The Shore At Katathani is an adult-only resort on Kata Noi Beach, marketing itself as 'The Green Hotel.' It implements several eco-friendly practices, including treating local community wastewater, maintaining a large rainwater reservoir, a zero-waste program transforming food waste into fertilizer, daily beach cleaning, and solar panel installations.
address_string: Kata Noi Beach, Phuket
description_short: Adult-only 'Green Hotel' resort on Kata Noi Beach with significant water and waste management initiatives.

eco_notes_detailed: Similar initiatives to The Shore: community wastewater treatment, beach cleaning (twice daily + patrols), solar power (1,000,000 watts/day), zero waste (recycles >80% waste, food waste to fertilizer), rainwater reservoir. Produces 'Ko Green' organic, biodegradable soaps on-site. Donates used bottle caps for prosthetic limbs. Educates local students on environmental protection ('Environmental Detectives' program). Winner of Phuket Zero Waste Contest. Tracks and reports Greenhouse Gas Emissions.
name: Katathani Phuket Beach Resort
description_long: Katathani Phuket Beach Resort, the sister resort to The Shore At Katathani, is located on Kata Noi Bay and is also marketed as a 'Green Hotel.' It shares similar comprehensive eco-friendly initiatives, including community wastewater treatment, extensive beach cleaning, solar power, a zero-waste program, rainwater harvesting, on-site production of biodegradable soaps, and environmental education programs.
address_string: Kata Noi Bay, Phuket
description_short: Sister resort to The Shore, also a 'Green Hotel' on Kata Noi Bay with comprehensive eco-initiatives.

eco_notes_detailed: 'Surrounded by lush greenery,' 'nestled beneath the rainforest canopy.' Has a dedicated 'Sustainability' page on its website. Offers 'Pure Cuisine' and 'Holistic Lifestyle' experiences, often indicative of eco-focus. Villas inspired by nature.
name: Keemala
description_long: Keemala is a 5-star luxury jungle and forest resort located in Kamala, Phuket. It is surrounded by lush greenery and nestled beneath the rainforest canopy. The resort has a dedicated 'Sustainability' page on its website and offers 'Pure Cuisine' and 'Holistic Lifestyle' experiences, often indicative of an eco-focus. Villas are inspired by nature.
address_string: Kamala, Phuket
description_short: 5-star luxury jungle and forest resort in Kamala, Phuket, with a dedicated sustainability page.

eco_notes_detailed: Certified 'Green Hotel Plus 2024'. Regular beach clean-ups and mangrove planting. Lush gardens nourished by natural fertilizers and on-site compost. Trees and plants selected for low water needs. Deep green cleaning practices. Energy-saving bulbs/LED lighting. Low-flow shower heads and faucet aerators. No single-use plastics, uses glass, reclaimed wood, recycled paper. Own herb and vegetable garden. Locally sourced seafood. 'Zero Miles Cocktails' (utilizing local ingredients, potentially reducing waste). Partners with eco-conscious dive operators and supports Phuket Elephant Sanctuary. 'The Giving Bag' initiative for local children in need.
name: The Nai Harn Phuket
description_long: The Nai Harn Phuket is a luxury resort overlooking Nai Harn Bay and a member of Leading Hotels of the World. It is certified 'Green Hotel Plus 2024' and implements numerous eco-friendly practices including beach clean-ups, mangrove planting, on-site composting, low-water landscaping, green cleaning, energy/water saving fixtures, no single-use plastics, an on-site herb/vegetable garden, locally sourced seafood, and partnerships with eco-conscious operators.
address_string: Nai Harn Bay, Phuket
description_short: Luxury resort overlooking Nai Harn Bay, certified 'Green Hotel Plus 2024' with extensive eco-practices.

eco_notes_detailed: Has a dedicated 'Sustainability' page. Emphasis on natural surroundings ('lush greenery'). Offers experiences like visiting an organic goat farm and local markets, suggesting a connection to local/sustainable produce.
name: Banyan Tree Phuket
description_long: Banyan Tree Phuket is an all-pool villa luxury resort located in Cherngtalay, nestled around a lagoon and surrounded by lush greenery. It has a dedicated 'Sustainability' page and offers experiences like visiting an organic goat farm and local markets, suggesting a connection to local and sustainable produce.
address_string: Cherngtalay, Phuket
description_short: All-pool villa luxury resort in Cherngtalay, nestled around a lagoon with lush greenery and a sustainability focus.

eco_notes_detailed: Explicitly states: 'We have always been a sustainable and eco-friendly coworking space.' Project E.ko Hub aims to be entirely off-grid. Uses its own organic farming for its kitchens and grows organic vegetables. Composts food waste and garden leaves. Provides reusable containers for water and food; sorts all waste. Lush 1,500 sqm tropical garden. Hopes to inspire local communities and nomads to adopt sustainable practices.
name: KoHub
description_long: KoHub is a well-known coworking and coliving space on Koh Lanta, operating seasonally (Nov-Apr). It boasts a strong community, fast internet, a tropical garden setting, and significant eco-friendly initiatives including organic farming, composting, waste reduction, and a project aiming for off-grid status.

eco_notes_detailed: Explicitly states: 'Sustainability @ COWORX.' 'At COWORX we take extensive affords to recycle and to do eveything possible to safe natural resources.' Provides free drinks (coffee, tea, water, soft drinks) using reusable glass bottles and cups, claiming to save ~12,000 plastic bottles per year. Offers free locally produced fair-trade coffee. Transparent electricity pricing for apartments (metered usage) to encourage conscious consumption. Features a relaxing outside area with a fish pond and garden.
name: COWORX Koh Lanta
description_long: COWORX Koh Lanta offers shared workspace, coworking, and fully serviced apartments in a co-living setup, located 3 minutes from the beach. They emphasize sustainability, taking extensive efforts to recycle and save natural resources, including providing free drinks in reusable containers to reduce plastic waste and offering locally produced fair-trade coffee.
address_string: Koh Lanta (3 minutes from the beach, exact address to be confirmed)
description_short: Coworking and co-living space on Koh Lanta with a focus on sustainability, recycling, and resource saving.

eco_notes_detailed: Name 'Eco Lanta' strongly suggests an eco-focus. 'Made of eco materials, bamboo is the fastest growing plants on earth which makes no pressure on earth.' (booking.com). Tripadvisor image caption: 'Live green and save the nature.'

name: Eco Lanta Hideaway Beach Resort
description_long: Eco Lanta Hideaway Beach Resort is located along the beachfront of Long Beach in Ko Lanta. The resort features Thai-style bungalows constructed from eco materials, with bamboo being specifically mentioned as a fast-growing, low-impact resource. An image on Tripadvisor also promotes a 'live green and save the nature' ethos.
